reviews.review_msg: He is willing to help when you have questions... even when he is busy! He is a very nice and caring prof who loves soccer! I was lost in the lectures but he normally tries to make me understand when I see him during his office hours or after class!
The assignments are mostly unrelated to the course and does not help you learn. Lecture are long and you don't need to attend them since you will do just fine reading slides at home.

The first half of health economics was good, but the second half made me want to poke my eyes out. He's kinda paradoxal with what he says and his direction throughout the whole course if you listen carefully. .. he wants students to have a more egalitarian view on the subject but at many times he is preaching from a libertarian standpoint

Great class and great prof! Health economics could have the potential of being a very dry course, but David makes it fun and exciting to study! There are two take-home midterms and a final exam where you get to know one of the questions before hand. Overall, this is a very fair and relatively easy course if you just put some effort into it!

Interesting class;you can learn a bunch of new things.It's essay based-one midterm & in-class final- so it seems hard, but if you stick to the guidelines, you'll be fine.He's pretty chilled with the students and welcomes questions.Bonus: the guy is unbelievably gorgeous! He could claim he's a movie star and people will line up to get his autograph.
